question:
Recently, the NDA government took the first step towards implementation of its ambitious National Health Protection Mission by approving the modalities of its implementation. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The scheme aims to provide an annual health care of Rs 5 lakh per family to 10 crore families in the country
  2. It envisages providing primary, secondary as well as tertiary healthcare to the people
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The scheme aims to provide an annual health care of Rs 5 Lakh per family to 10 crore families in the country. <u>Second statement is also correct</u>. Besides providing secondary and tertiary healthcare to individuals, the scheme also envisages providing 1.5 lakh wellness centres across the country for the primary health care of individuals. The AB-NHPM will subsume the on-going centrally sponsored schemes â€“Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) and the Senior Citizen Health Insurance Scheme (CHIS). The central government would ask the States/ UTs to implement the scheme by a dedicated entity called State Health Agency (SHA).
